title: Parent takes a swipe at Schoolies organisers for encouraging teen revelers to hook up on Tinder
text:
A Queensland mother has slammed Schoolies organisers for encouraging teenage revellers to hook up at their events using Tinder.

Libby Marshall's daughter is graduating Year 12 from Brisbane's All Hallows' School and will be celebrating Schoolies in Surfers Paradise with her classmates this November.

Like many parents, Ms Marshall is concerned for her daughter's safety at the upcoming events, and was shocked to see a new campaign advertising the popular dating app through Schoolies official channels.

She recently received an email from Schoolies organisers publicising their new collaboration with Tinder, including the tagline 'GET ON THIS.'

A Queensland mother has slammed Schoolies organisers for encouraging teenage revellers to hook up at their events using Tinder (pictured: a young couple embrace during Schoolies celebrations on the Gold Coast in 2009)

The email Ms Marshall received (pictured) encouraging impressionable school leavers to 'make every SINGLE moment count.'

'Tinder is coming to Schoolies in 2019 to help you make every SINGLE moment count,' the email read.

'Because we know single never has to go home early, knows all the best places and goes home with the wildest stories.'

Ms Marshall slammed organisers as she believes Schoolies should be a celebration of achievement and shouldn't be promoting casual sex to impressionable young people.

'It’s planting the seed that spontaneous, casual sex with anyone is okay and I think it’s completely the wrong message to be sending to our kids,' Ms Marshall told The Courier Mail.

'It makes me sick in the stomach to think Schoolies is officially sanctioning this sort of thinking.'

Tinder is offering school leavers exclusive access to numerous events and parties throughout Schoolies celebrations by using Festival Mode on the app.

Ms Marshall has written a formal complaint to Schoolies and believes organisers have missed the target with their new campaign.

'Why should we be exposing kids to this?' Ms Marshall said. 'It’s not acceptable. Where is the moral compass of the world?'
description: A Queensland mother has slammed Schoolies organisers for encouraging teenage revelers to hook up at their events using Tinder.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
